column4: hi people, trying to update / upgrade on karmik, i have problems with rsyslog (invoke-rc.d action "restart" failed)
can any one help ?
you upgraded it, did you ?
apt-get install rsyslog is that so ?
fix is simple, start rsyslog (service rsyslog start).
then restart the upgrade.
paste the output of the session.
here it is : http://pastebin.com/m465135ca
sorry for time, I sent it to sebsebseb thinking you were the same ;)
I stand corrected. Do a service rsyslog start then dpkg --configure -a should do the trick
dpkg --configure -a does not do anything better
in fact, rsyslog is not running right now and can't be restarted with service rsyslog start
wait, it can be started, it was actually stoped, this is why restart did not work, now its running
dpkg says "/etc/init.d/rsyslog: 46: s: not found"
that script is corrupted, ending with a "s" line
removing this lines gets dpkg to do its work
should I post a bug report ?
Maybe yes, file a bug.
thank you
Already done : https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rsyslog/+bug/460876
oh all right then :)
Which file got an extra trailing s ?
